title: Oxtail Stew
ingredients: Olive oil – Sunflower, safflower, avocado, grape seed, or vegetable oils can be used instead.
Oxtails – Make sure they’re fully thawed before starting.
Onion – White or yellow work best.
Green onion – Use more or less as per your preference, this is for garnish only.
Tomato paste – Make sure it’s the paste – not sauce or pureed.
Habanero – Use more, less, or none as you prefer.
Seasonings – Allspice, smoked paprika, thyme, bay leaves.
Soy sauce – You can also add a bit of Worcestershire if preferred.
Beef broth – Other types of broth will work, but beef broth will give the deepest flavor.
Lima beans – Butter beans, or white/navy beans will also work.
steps: Sear the oxtails: Heat the olive oil in a large braiser or Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Season the oxtails with salt and pepper, and sear them on all sides until browned.

Sauté: Add the onion to the pot and cook until translucent and softened. Add the garlic, ginger, and habanero, then stir and cook for 1 minute. Stir in the allspice, smoked paprika, soy sauce, and tomato paste, then cook until the paste browns slightly.

Braise: Add the oxtails back to the pot. Stir in the beef broth, thyme, and bay leaves, then bring the pot to a boil. Turn the heat to low, cover with a lid slightly cracked, and simmer for 2 hours. Remove the lid, stir in the butter beans, and simmer uncovered for another 30-45 minutes.

Finish: Remove the bay leaves and thyme sprigs. Whisk the cornstarch with 1 tbsp water to create a slurry. Stir the slurry into the pot and increase the heat to medium, stirring until the mixture thickens. Garnish with freshly chopped green onion.

title: Spaghetti Aglio e Olio
steps: Cook spaghetti in salted water until al dente, then drain, reserving 1/2 cup of pasta water.
Heat olive oil in a pan over medium heat, add garlic and red pepper flakes, and sauté until garlic is golden.
Add cooked pasta to the pan along with reserved pasta water, stirring to coat.
Season with salt and black pepper, then toss with fresh parsley before serving.

title: Chicken Tikka Masala
steps: Marinate chicken in yogurt and spices for at least 1 hour.
Sauté garlic and ginger in oil, then add tomato sauce and cook until thick.
Add cream and cooked chicken, then simmer for 10 minutes until flavors blend.
Serve hot with rice or naan bread.

title: Tacos
steps: Cook ground meat with onion and spices until browned.
Warm tortillas on a skillet.
Assemble tacos with meat, cheese, lettuce, and salsa.

title: French Crepes
steps: Whisk all ingredients into a smooth batter.
Cook thin crepes in a non-stick pan.
Fill with fruit, chocolate, or cheese, then fold and serve.

title: Shakshuka
steps: Sauté onions, peppers, and garlic with spices.
Add tomatoes and simmer until thick.
Crack eggs into the sauce and cook until set.

title: Cheeseburger
steps: Grill beef patty and melt cheese on top.
Toast buns and assemble with toppings.

title: Butter Chicken
steps: Cook chicken with spices.
Make a creamy tomato sauce and combine.

title: Stir-Fried Noodles
steps: Cook noodles and stir-fry with sauce and veggies.

title: Pancakes
steps: Mix batter and cook on a pan.
Serve with syrup or fruit.
